newsitem.title: USA: FCOJ futures end as lower as storm threat eases.
newsitem.headline: FCOJ futures end as lower as storm threat eases.

text.p: FCOJ settled lower as speculators and locals sold off towards the end of the session, reassured by hurricanes avoiding any of the U.S. growing regions.
A floor source said speculative selling began when the November contract fell below 114.00 cents per pound.
However, the fall was eased by some light scale-down buying by the trade, floor traders said.
November orange juice settled 0.90 cent lower at 113.85 cents per pound, traded 115.20 to 113.50 cents. Spot September tumbled 1.55 cents to 118.10 cents.

Hurricane Edouard lost strength and turned north on Friday, lessening its threat to the U.S. Atlantic coast. Hurricane Fran and tropical storm Gustav were still far from land, the National Hurricane Center said late-morning.
